alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:22PM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Middle Haddam. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Flooding closes most of Meadow Road, Route 17A, in the Gildersleeve section of Portland. Flooding impacts the Middletown Marina and Meadow Farms. In Cromwell, portions of River Road will be closed. In Rocky Hill, parts of Meadow Road will be impassable for a time. Flooding continues along the river southward through Essex. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 9.3 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall Thursday morning. It will rise to 9.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall Thursday evening. It will rise to 9.1 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 04/17/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 630 AM EDT.
